tracks.title: Senior Orchestrator â€“ Multi-Agent Systems
tracks.summary: Design, orchestrate, and harden multi-agent systems with real tools, guardrails, and eval loops.

quests.title: Agent Graph & Role Map
quests.summary: Define a multi-agent graph with clear roles, responsibilities, and communication patterns.
quests.objective: Produce a concrete agent map (planner, workers, reviewers, tools) for a realistic use case, including responsibilities, hand-off rules, and failure modes.

quests.title: Tool Contracts & IO Design
quests.summary: Turn messy tools into reliable, typed contracts agents can safely call.
quests.objective: Design a set of tool contracts (schemas, error handling, timeouts, idempotency) for a multi-agent system. Deliver typed interfaces plus a short rationale.

quests.title: Guardrails & Policy Layer
quests.summary: Add a policy layer that constrains what agents can do and how they talk.
quests.objective: Specify prompts, policies, and filters that prevent unsafe actions, constrain tool use, and handle denials gracefully in a multi-agent setting.

quests.title: Evaluator in the Loop
quests.summary: Design an evaluation agent and metrics for multi-step plans.
quests.objective: Define an evaluator/critic loop with quantitative and qualitative signals, including how to sample runs, label them, and feed improvements back into prompts or policies.

quests.title: Resilience & Observability
quests.summary: Make the orchestrator debuggable and resilient in production.
quests.objective: Design logging, tracing, and recovery strategies for a multi-agent orchestrator, including what to log, how to inspect stuck runs, and how to safely abort.

bosses.title: Oracle Orchestrator Prime
bosses.summary: Guardian of multi-agent orchestration. Tests your ability to design a safe, observable, tool-using agent system end-to-end.
